conclusion: The problem involves determining the maximum electromotive force (EMF) generated by a rotating-armature AC generator with given parameters.
The magnetic flux through each turn of the coil varies sinusoidally with time as shown in the graph, and the plane of the coil is parallel to the magnetic field at t=0.
Figure (A) shows a schematic diagram of the AC generator with a rotating rectangular coil, slip rings, and a resistor R connected in parallel with an ideal AC voltmeter.
Figure (Z) shows the sinusoidal variation of magnetic flux Φ with time t, where the amplitude of Φ is 2.0 × 10^-2 Wb and the period is 6.28 × 10^-2 s.
The period T of the magnetic flux is determined from the graph as 6.28 × 10^-2 s.
The angular frequency ω is calculated using ω = 2π/T, resulting in ω = 100 rad/s.
The maximum EMF is given by E_max = nΦ₀ω, where n = 100, Φ₀ = 2.0 × 10^-2 Wb, and ω = 100 rad/s. Substituting these values gives E_max = 200 V.
The RMS value of the EMF is calculated as E_RMS = E_max/√2, resulting in E_RMS = 141.4 V.
The RMS voltage across the resistor R is given by V_RMS = E_RMS / (R + r), where R = 90 Ω and r = 10 Ω. Substituting values gives V_RMS = 1.414 V.
The RMS voltage across the resistor matches the amplitude of the voltage from the graph, confirming the calculation of E_RMS = 141.4 V.
The maximum EMF is confirmed as E_max = √2 × E_RMS = 200 V.
The final answer is that the maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 200 V.
